description: Infectious bursal disease is an acute and highly contagious disease which is mostly affects young chickens of 3-6 weeks old. The disease, also named “Gumboro disease” according to the location of the first outbreaks in Gumboro, Delaware, USA, was initially described as avian nephrosis due to damage seen in the kidneys,but was later designated infectious bursal disease (IBD) according to varying morphologic and histological changes observed in the bursa of Fabricius.
name: Infectious Bursal Disease Virus Antibodies and Antigens
